title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<UCC> has quit

07:50 <UCC> has quit  
10:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <abusenius> has quit  
11:10 <crocket> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <crocket> hi guys  
11:10 <crocket> I peered into xwiki-platform code.  
11:11 <crocket> It is a well organized modules grouped together as maven modules.  
11:11 <crocket> It was a pleasure to see clean and modular code.  
11:11 <crocket> On the contrary, my company's web office codebase is a giant mud of java packages(com.java.blahblah)  
11:12 <crocket> It becomes terrible to maintain when a part of it has to diverge.  
11:12 <crocket> You need to understand a lot of codebase to modify a small part.  
11:13 <crocket> With modular design, I only have to understand a module and its interface.  
12:48 <sburjan`> has quit  
12:53 <vmassol> crocket: thanks for the feedback! Glad you like it. We still have a lot of work to do though ;)  
12:54 <crocket> vmassol, I recently became depressed by my company's giant monlithic codebase.  
12:54 <crocket> It's even based on ant.  
12:54 <vmassol> yeah that was the case on xwiki too when I joined the project back in 2006  
12:55 <vmassol> xwiki was also on Ant at the time ;-  
12:55 <vmassol> ;)  
12:55 <vmassol> we still have some trace of this monomothic code in xwiki-platform-oldcore  
12:55 <vmassol> after 6+ years we still haven't finished the move  
12:55 <crocket> How did you do it?  
12:55 <vmassol> slowly over time without breaking anything  
12:55 <vmassol> this is why it took so long  
12:55 <vmassol> no revolution, just evolution keeping backward compat  
12:56 <vmassol> we already had users and we didn't want to break them  
12:56 <vmassol> various strategies  
12:56 <vmassol> for example for the rendering  
12:56 <vmassol> we decided to not touch as the exisitng rendering and to make xwiki polyglot  
12:56 <vmassol> this allowed us to call the existing syntx XWiki 1.0 and introduce XWiki 2.0  
12:57 <vmassol> and in the process this gave us the opportunity to support a lot of other syntaxes  
12:57 <vmassol> that's just one example of a strategy  
12:57 <vmassol> then we used the legacy module strategy  
12:57 <vmassol> (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HBackwardCompatibility)  
12:57 <vmassol> lunch time here! :) have fun  
12:58 <crocket> vmassol, Can you come back and continue?  
13:09 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
13:22 <crocket> vmassol, I guess you must have required a high degree of autonomy and trust from xwiki company since it requires management to trust you enough not to tell you what to do on a regular basis.  
13:22 <crocket> in other words, closed allocation for you.  
14:10 <crocket> Lack of autonomy is a big issue in applying modularity in my job.
